reasoning: PAD is a chronic atherosclerotic disease best characterized by prevalence (~4.2% of global population, ~4,200 per 100k). Reporting both prevalence (primary metric for chronic conditions) and incidence of new diagnoses (~0.8 per 100k person-years). Global prevalence varies by age and region, from ~1-2% in younger populations to 15-20% in elderly (>70 years). Global average estimated at 4-5% based on WHO and epidemiological surveys.
source: Fowkes FG et al. (2017). Comparison of global estimates of prevalence and risk factors of peripheral artery disease in 2000 and 2010. Lancet. 382(9901):1329-1340
